questions.name: Welcome
questions.title: Welcome
questions.description: Let’s see if your business qualifies for the Paycheck Protection Program.

questions.name: businessSuspended
questions.title: Is the Applicant or any owner of the Applicant presently suspended, debarred, proposed for debarment, declared ineligible, voluntarily excluded from participation in this transaction by any Federal department or agency, or presently involved in any bankruptcy?

questions.name: businessDefaulted
questions.title: Has the Applicant, any owner of the Applicant, or any business owned or controlled by any of them, ever obtained a direct or guaranteed loan from SBA or any other Federal agency that is currently delinquent or has defaulted in the last 7 years and caused a loss to the government?

questions.name: ownerIndictment
questions.title: Is the Applicant (if an individual) or any individual owning 20% or more of the equity of the Applicant subject to an indictment, criminal information, arraignment, or other means by which formal criminal charges are brought in any jurisdiction, or presently incarcerated, or on probation or parole?

questions.name: ownerConvicted
questions.title: Within the last 5 years, for any felony, has the Applicant (if an individual) or any owner of the Applicant:
questions.description: 1) been convicted; 2) pleaded guilty; 3) pleaded nolo contendere; 4) been placed on pretrial diversion; or 5) been placed on any form of parole or probation (including probation before judgment)?

questions.name: businessRejection
questions.description: Unfortunately, your business does not qualify for this program.

questions.name: typeOfBusiness
questions.title: What type of business is this?

questions.name: businessLegalName
questions.title: What is the name of your business?

questions.name: businessSSN
questions.title: - OR -
questions.required: Please enter valid business EIN OR SSN

questions.name: averageMonthlyPayroll
questions.title: What is the average monthly payroll of your business? (ONLY employees who are U.S. residents)
questions.tooltipText: For purposes of calculating “Average Monthly Payroll,” most Applicants will use the average monthly payroll for 2019, excluding costs over $100,000 on an annualized basis for each employee who is a U.S. resident.  For seasonal businesses, the Applicant may elect to instead use average monthly payroll for the time period between February 15, 2019 and June 30, 2019, excluding costs over $100,000 on an annualized basis for each employee.  For new businesses, average monthly payroll may be calculated using the time period from January 1, 2020 to February 29, 2020, excluding costs over $100,000 on an annualized basis for each employee.

questions.name: numberOfJobs
questions.title: Number of Jobs / Employees in your business who are U.S. residents?
questions.placeholder: Number of Jobs / Employees in your business

questions.name: loanPurposePayroll
questions.title: What is the purpose of this loan? (Check all that apply)
questions.required: Please check at least one Loan Purpose.

questions.name: loanPurpose
questions.title: What is the purpose of this loan? (Check all that apply)

questions.name: multipleOwnership
questions.title: We now need to gather some information on each of the owners of your business who have greater than 20% ownership in the business.
questions.description: Do you have any owners with a 21% or greater stake in the business?

questions.name: ownerprimaryContact
questions.title: Is this owner the primary contact (Authorized Representative) for the business?

questions.name: ownerFirstName
questions.title: What is the name of Owner {{X}}?

questions.name: ownerContact
questions.title: What is the name of Owner {{X}}?

questions.name: percentOwnership
questions.title: Percentage of the business owned by Owner {{X}}?
questions.errormessage: Please enter Ownership Percentage between 21 to 100

questions.name: ownerSSN
questions.title: - OR -
questions.required: Please enter valid owner EIN OR SSN

questions.name: ownerEmail
questions.title: Owner {{X}}’s Email Address
questions.errormessage: Please enter a valid owner email address.
questions.required: Please enter a valid owner email address.

questions.name: additionalOwner
questions.title: Are there any other owners who have a 21% or greater stake in the business?

questions.name: primaryContactFirstName
questions.title: Who is the Primary Contact (Authorized Representative) for the business?

questions.name: PrimaryContact
questions.title: Who is the Primary Contact (Authorized Representative) for the business?

questions.name: primaryContactEmail
questions.title: Primary Contact Email Address
questions.errormessage: Please enter a valid email address.
questions.required: Please enter a valid email address.

questions.name: primaryContactTitle
questions.title: Primary Contact Title
questions.required: Please enter a Primary Contact Title.

questions.name: businessOwnOther
questions.title: Is the Applicant or any owner of the Applicant an owner of any other business, or have common management with, any other business?
questions.description: If yes, you will be asked to upload an Addendum with details later in this application process.

questions.name: receivedEIDL
questions.title: Has the Applicant / Business received an Economic Injury Disaster Loan (EIDL) between January 31, 2020 and April 3, 2020?

questions.name: EIDLOutstandingAmount
questions.title: Enter the outstanding amount of the Economic Injury Disaster Loan (EIDL) minus the amount of any “advance” taken under an EIDL COVID-19 loan ($10,000).

questions.name: USResidence
questions.title: Is the United States the principal place of residence for all employees of the Applicant included in the Applicant’s payroll calculation above?

questions.name: SBAFranchiseDirectory
questions.title: If the Applicant is a franchise, is it listed in the SBA’s Franchise Directory? If the applicant is not a franchise, select “Not Applicable”.
